#Text=Gary Winnick ( game developer )
#Text=Gary Winnick is an American computer game designer , writer , artist , and animator who was the first artist hired by Lucasfilm Games . [ 1 ]
#Text=He co-designed Maniac Mansion , alongside Ron Gilbert , [ 2 ] and created the comic book Bad Dreams . [ 3 ]
#Text=Career
#Text=Gary Winnick founded Horizon Zero Graphiques with Frank Cirocco in 1974 .
#Text=There , he was the editor , artist , and writer for the comic magazine Venture , which ran until 1976 .
#Text=Horizon Zero Graphiques also published the comic magazine Mindworks by Brent Anderson , which included art by Gary .
#Text=He began his video game career at LucasArts as the only artist and animator at the then-newly formed Lucasfilm Games Division in 1984 . [ 4 ]
#Text=He worked as an artist and animator on the early games by Lucasfilm Games , before he became co-designer of the 1987 adventure game , Maniac Mansion . [ 5 ]
#Text=He continued working on art and animation at LucasArts , and became the art department supervisor on Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade : The Graphic Adventure in 1989 .
#Text=In 1992 , he was the designer , artist , and animator on Defenders of Dynatron City and co-wrote the comic based on the game , with Steve Purcell . [ 6 ]
#Text=Before leaving LucasArts in 1993 , he contributed dialog and story to the sequel to Maniac Mansion , Day of the Tentacle .
#Text=After leaving LucasArts , he joined Spectrum Holobyte as an art director .
#Text=In 1995 , he co-founded the video game company , Orbital Studios , where he served as executive producer .
#Text=In 1996 , he returned as a partner at Horizon Zero Graphiques , which was rebranded Lightsource Studios .
#Text=He also co-created the comic book Neomen with Frank Cirocco in 1987 and created the comic book Bad Dreams in 2014 .
#Text=The first issue of Bad Dreams was in the list of the top six new comics and sold out in its first week of release . [ 7 ]

#Text=Gary Winnick reunited with Ron Gilbert , with whom he co-created his early critically acclaimed point'n'click games for LucasArts , and both of them ran a Kickstarter campaign for a new point'n'click game called Thimbleweed Park .
#Text=The campaign ended on December 18 , 2014 and the game was released on March 30 , 2017 . [ 8 ]
